definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: A: Well, you’re a busy man, Mr. Smith.
sentences.chinese: 好了，史密斯先生，您是個大忙人。

sentences.english: For example, I can say I'm busy.
sentences.chinese: 舉個例子吧，我說我是大忙人。

sentences.english: So I am a busy guy.
Everybody knows graph king is very busy person, taking jotter at any time.
sentences.chinese: 大家都知道圖王是大忙人的，隨時都拿着筆記本。

definition: lit. One doesn't visit a temple without a cause. (idiom)/fig. to visit sb with an ulterior motive (esp. to ask for sth)/having a hidden agenda
pinyin: wu2 shi4 bu4 deng1 san1 bao3 dian4

definition: I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time (idiom)
see 貴人多忘|贵人多忘[gui4 ren2 duo1 wang4]
to avoid external disturbance in order to idle
we are honored by your presence
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
feet not touching the ground (idiom)/to run like the wind
honorific: I've long looked forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
